subject: Travel
title: Tourism and Ancient Sites
description: A quick, practical guide to Tourism and Ancient Sites.

hook.text: Ancient Romans were tourists too. They carved their names into Egyptian monuments.

buildup.text: Graffiti from Roman soldiers has been found inside the Great Pyramid dating to 30 BC.

discovery.text: Tourism as an industry exploded in the 1800s when railways made travel affordable.

twist.text: Today, the Colosseum loses 1mm of stone per year from 7 million visitors touching its walls.

climax.text: Some sites now limit visitors. Lascaux Cave was sealed and a replica built next door.

punchline.text: Loving ancient places to death is a modern problem.

quiz.question: Why was the original Lascaux Cave sealed?
options: Tourist visits were destroying the paintings
